020
021import net.tnemc.core.currency.Denomination;
022
023import java.math.BigDecimal;
024import java.util.Map;
025
026/**
027 * CalculationProvider
028 *
029 * @author creatorfromhell
030 * @since 0.1.2.0
031 */
032public class ItemCalculations<I> {
033
034  /**
035   * Used to calculate the holdings of the inventory materials present.
036   *
037   * @return The {@link BigDecimal} representation of the inventory materials balance value.
038   */
039  public BigDecimal calculateHoldings(final CalculationData<I> data) {
040
041    BigDecimal holdings = BigDecimal.ZERO;
042
043    for(final Map.Entry<BigDecimal, Denomination> entry : data.getDenominations().entrySet()) {
044      final int amount = data.getInventoryMaterials().getOrDefault(entry.getKey(), 0);
045
046      if(amount > 0) {
047        holdings = holdings.add(entry.getKey().multiply(new BigDecimal(amount)));
048      }
049    }
050    return holdings;
051  }
052
053  public void setItems(final CalculationData<I> data, final BigDecimal amount) {
054
055    final BigDecimal holdings = calculateHoldings(data);
056
057    if(holdings.compareTo(amount) == 0) return;
058
059    if(holdings.compareTo(amount) > 0) {
060      calculation(data, holdings.subtract(amount));
061      return;
062    }
063    provideMaterials(data, amount.subtract(holdings));
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Used to calculate the materials that need to be removed when a player in an item-based economy
068   * has money taken from their account.
069   *
070   * @param change The amount to remove from the player's account.
071   *
072   * @return The {@link BigDecimal} representation of the leftover amount that couldn't be removed
073   * because there's no more materials left to remove.
074   */
075  public BigDecimal calculation(final CalculationData<I> data, final BigDecimal change) {
076
077    data.getCalculator().initialize(data.getCurrency(), data.getInventoryMaterials());
078
079    data.getCalculator().calculateDenominationCounts(change);
080
081    for(final Map.Entry<BigDecimal, Integer> entry : data.getCalculator().getToAdd().entrySet()) {
082
083      Integer amount = entry.getValue();
084
085      final Integer removeAmount = data.getCalculator().getToRemove().getOrDefault(entry.getKey(), 0);
086
087      if(removeAmount > 0 && amount > removeAmount) {
088
089        amount = amount - removeAmount;
090      }
091
092      if(removeAmount > 0 && amount <= removeAmount) {
093
094        continue;
095      }
096
097      //PluginCore.log().debug("calculation Amount getToAdd:" + entry.getKey().toPlainString() + " Count:" + amount, DebugLevel.DEVELOPER);
098
099      data.provideMaterials(data.getDenominations().get(entry.getKey()), amount);
100    }
101
102    for(final Map.Entry<BigDecimal, Integer> entry : data.getCalculator().getToRemove().entrySet()) {
103
104      //PluginCore.log().debug("calculation Amount getToRemove:" + entry.getKey().toPlainString() + " Count:" + entry.getValue(), DebugLevel.DEVELOPER);
105
106      data.removeMaterials(data.getDenominations().get(entry.getKey()), entry.getValue());
107    }
108
109
110    return BigDecimal.ZERO;
111  }
112
113  /**
114   * Used to exchange an amount to inventory items. This is mostly used for when a larger
115   * denomination needs to be broken into smaller denominations for calculation purposes.
116   *
117   * @param amount The amount that the items should add up to.
118   */
119  public void provideMaterials(final CalculationData<I> data, final BigDecimal amount) {
120
121    data.getCalculator().initialize(data.getCurrency(), data.getInventoryMaterials());
122
123    for(final Map.Entry<BigDecimal, Integer> entry : data.getCalculator().breakdown(amount).entrySet()) {
124
125      final int holding = data.getInventoryMaterials().getOrDefault(entry.getKey(), 0);
126      data.getInventoryMaterials().put(entry.getKey(), holding + entry.getValue());
127      data.provideMaterials(data.getDenominations().get(entry.getKey()), entry.getValue());
128    }
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * Used to remove tiers from the {@link CalculationData} being worked with.
133   *
134   * @param denom  The denom name in String form.
135   * @param amount The amount of the material to remove from working materials.
136   */
137  public void removeMaterials(final CalculationData<I> data, final Denomination denom, final Integer amount) {
138
139    data.removeMaterials(denom, amount);
140  }
141}
